description:
In the blink of the mind's eye, Ryouta Sakamoto suddenly finds himself transported from playing the hit Btoom! video game to being stranded on a mysterious island, equipped with a day's worth of provisions, a bag of bombs, a strange crystal embedded in his left hand and a huge gaping hole in his memory. But it doesn't take long to figure out what's going on, especially after the first person Ryouta meets tries to kill him. Someone is attempting to recreate the ultra-violent Btoom! game in real life, and the island has been filled with an army of other unwilling players, each armed with one of the multiple variants of explosive weapons called BIM. Fortunately, Ryouta's an ace Btoom! player, but this insane version of the game has no reset switch or second lives, and there's only one way off the island: kill seven other people before they can kill you! Can Ryouta repurpose his game based skills fast enough to survive?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

He has done design and illustration work for video game development companies Toaplan, Gazelle, and Cave before working as a mangaka.

[Website](http://www5.airnet.ne.jp/jokerjun/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/JokeRJUN)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

Shingo Suzuki is an animator previously belonging to Gonzo and Satelight and now affiliated with GoHands.  He was being influenced by Masami Obari and Fumihide Sai and is particularly known for his bold and peculiar shading and high level drawings.

[Official Website](https://nanonano.me/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanonano_me?s=20&t=4VTA1umvQXVSsyul5mYvQg) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/officialnanoTV) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nanonano_me/?hl=ja)


nano is a female singer/song writer on NicoNicoDouga who covers Vocaloid and non-Vocaloid songs in Japanese and English. She has participated in many translations and collaborations because of fluency. nano moved back to Japan during middle school. This is where the “帰国子女” in one of his or her video titles comes from. Kikokushijo means “one who has returned to their homeland”.

Graduated: Aichi University of the Arts (March, 2007)

Kotono Watanabe is a Japanese director and storyboard artist, who mainly does episode direction. After her graduation from Aichi University she joined studio Madhouse in April of the same year.
Keiji Inai is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with the music production company IMAGINE.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱田邦彦) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/guresam0511) 

Often works with [Morio Asaka](https://anilist.co/staff/100921/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/いしづかあつこ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atsuko_Ishizuka)

Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

Known for directing shows such as [A Place Further Than the Universe](https://anilist.co/anime/99426/), and [No Game No Life](https://anilist.co/anime/19815/).

[Twitter](https://x.com/Cobalt1604)

Originating from MADHOUSE.

Freelance director. Formerly affiliated with MADHOUSE, Production IMS, XEBEC and David Production.
